Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bracelet
Description: Small circular bracelet in the shape of ring, perfectly polished. The bracelets of this type, more or less large, were found in great numbers in the C-Group necropolis of of Aksha. The ivory, as worked by the ancient Nubian population, was used both for the manufacture of corporal ornaments as for inlays on furniture or on tools. At the beginning of the 2nd millenium B.C., elephants still frequented the borders of the Nile.
